wikipedia_page.main: Edward Adams (24 February 1824 – 12 November 1856) was an English Royal Navy officer, naval surgeon, naturalist, artist, and Arctic explorer.

link_mentions.page: List of authors of names published under the ICZN

response: *Edward Adams (footballer) (1908–1981), English footballer who played for Tranmere Rovers
*Edward Adams (surgeon) (1824–1856), English naval surgeon and naturalist

In 1848, she accompanied  on James Clark Ross's expedition to find the missing Franklin expedition. Also aboard Investigator on this expedition was naturalist Edward Adams. On their return journey she was commanded by Robert McClure, but the ship became trapped in the pack ice at Mercy Bay adjoining Banks Island. The decision was eventually taken to abandon her on 3 June 1853, after she had been stuck for nearly three years.
